localised_text.last_approved_text:
The strength of the Geomantic Web affects the power of commandments issued across your territory.

A settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential strength.

The colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current strength of the Geomantic Web there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential strength - upgrade the strength of the web in nearby settlements in this case.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
The strength of the Geomantic Web affects the power of commandments issued across your territory.

A settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential strength.

The colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current strength of the Geomantic Web there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential strength - upgrade the strength of the web in nearby settlements in this case.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The strength of the Geomantic Web is determined by the strongest link between a province capital and its nearest neighbour. It dictates the level of the commandment that can be applied across this province.||The Geomantic Web's links can be viewed by clicking on the dedicated button on the right-hand side of the campaign interface. Links can be strengthened by constructing the Geomantic Web building chain or via alliances.

localised_text.last_approved_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_slaves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Slaves[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Dark Elf factions capture [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in battle. [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves provide additional [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income, but can negatively affect [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order. [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves can also be sacrificed to perform rites.

[[url:script_link_campaign_black_arks]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Black Arks[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
By performing a Sacrifice to Mathlann rite, Dark Elf factions may summon a mighty Black Ark. These powerful floating fortresses can be used far from home to raise armies, recruit units, and support invasion forces with aerial bombardments.

Learn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

The depraved nature of Morathi and her Cult of Pleasure spreads [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption wherever they settle.

Learn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_slaves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Slaves[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Dark Elf factions capture [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in battle. [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves provide additional [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income, but can negatively affect [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order. [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves can also be sacrificed to perform rites.

[[url:script_link_campaign_black_arks]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Black Arks[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
By performing a Sacrifice to Mathlann rite, Dark Elf factions may summon a mighty Black Ark. These powerful floating fortresses can be used far from home to raise armies, recruit units, and support invasion forces with aerial bombardments.

[[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Chaos Corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The depraved nature of Morathi and her Cult of Pleasure spreads [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption wherever they settle.

Learn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

localised_text.last_approved_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elf factions gain [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence as political events fall in their favour, which may be spent on court intrigues and on recruiting more powerful [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.

[[url:script_link_campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Intrigue at the Court[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elves can spend their [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence on Intrigues at the Court - whispered deals in the halls of power that pull strings to improve or worsen the diplomatic relations between factions.

[[url:script_link_campaign_espionage]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Espionage[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elves use [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements to spy on their partners. High Elf factions have full visibility over the territory of any faction they trade with.

Learn more about High Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_high_elves]]here[[/url]].

localised_text.last_approved_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Lizardmen settlements are linked by an unseen network of power that spans the world. By increasing the power of the Geomantic Web in a province, a Lizardmen faction can increase the potency of any commandments issued there.

[[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The spawning pools of Lustria will occasionally bring forth an especially gifted set of warriors, which may be recruited once a special mission is completed.

Learn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text:

localised_text.last_approved_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Underworld[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Skaven settlements are not ordinarily visible to other races, appearing instead as uninhabited ruins. [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes may scout ruins to see if they are truly abandoned.

[[url:script_link_campaign_food]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Food[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Skaven factions require a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food, each army consuming an amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food per turn. [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food may be gained from battles, from sacking settlements, and from certain buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption where they settle, lowering [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order over time but giving additional uses of [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_menace_below}}]]the Menace Below[[/tooltip]][[/url]] army ability in battles fought within the local province.

Learn more about the Skaven [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven]]here[[/url]].

localised_text.last_approved_text:
[[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Within the Black Pyramid a great power lies dormant, waiting to be unlocked by the bearer of the nine Books of Nagash.

Collect the Books of Nagash and win the Battle for the Black Pyramid to achieve this campaign's victory conditions.

[[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Day of Awakening[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings factions can recruit units into their armies without the need to pay for their recruitment or upkeep. Instead, each unit has a limited initial recruitment capacity which can be increased by constructing additional buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Dynasties[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb King factions must delve into their past secrets to increase the number of armies or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes they can field, or to enlist the aid of mighty [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords from ancient dynasties.

[[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Mortuary Cult[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings can spend their [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars within the Mortuary Cult, where Liche Priests combine them with [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade resources to craft magic items or awaken Legions of Legend - mighty warriors who can be recruited to battle.

Learn more about Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_tomb_kings]]here[[/url]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Artillery [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], such as cannons and catapults, can fire projectiles at the enemy over long distances. localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] fight most effectively against an enemy in front of them. A unit will take more casualties and its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] will suffer when attacked in the flank or the rear.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Multiple [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] may be assigned into a preset formation, in which they automatically take up positions in a specific arrangement.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Formations button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when more than one unit is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Formations button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when more than one unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Large cities are fortified by walls, punctuated by towers and gates. The attacker must breach the fortifications during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] to take the city, while the defender can man the walls in an attempt to stop them.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Large cities are fortified by walls, punctuated by towers and gates. The attacker must breach the fortifications during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] to take the city, while the defender can man the walls in an attempt to stop them.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Group button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Group button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A selection of [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may be grouped by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_group_button]]Group button[[/sl_tooltip]] so that they may be easily re-selected in future. Grouped units are arranged together under a tab on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Grouped units are arranged together under a tab on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Guard button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can guard is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Guard button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can guard is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with hand-to-hand weapons. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with hand-to-hand weapons. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is a measure of its will to continue fighting. If the [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a unit drops too low then the troops will rout from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] and stop responding to orders.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Melee Mode button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can toggle melee mode is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Melee Mode button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can toggle melee mode is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire, sling or hurl projectiles at the enemy.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire, sling or hurl projectiles at the enemy.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Monsters and giants are huge, powerful creatures that inspire terror into their enemies. They are best used for scattering and disrupting formations of enemy [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Monsters and giants are huge, powerful creatures that inspire terror into their enemies. They are best used for scattering and disrupting formations of enemy [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mounted [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are able to move quickly across the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either in support of allied troops or to strike at the enemy where they are weakest.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Mounted [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are able to move quickly across the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either in support of allied troops or to strike at the enemy where they are weakest.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Dark Elves perform worship to Khaine, the god of murder, through the shedding of blood on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]]. A Dark Elf [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] will receive favour in the form of increased combat performance should they kill enough enemies during battle.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Certain Lizardmen [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may rampage when they take too much damage in battle. Rampaging units will continue to fight but will no longer respond to orders.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Certain Lizardmen [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may rampage when they take too much damage in battle. Rampaging units will continue to fight but will no longer respond to orders.

localised_text.last_approved_text: As Tomb Kings warriors die on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], their spirits enter the Realm of Souls. As the Realm of Souls fills past certain thresholds, the [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] that remain will regenerate for short periods.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As Tomb Kings warriors die on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], their spirits enter the Realm of Souls. As the Realm of Souls fills past certain thresholds, the [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] that remain will regenerate for short periods.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Siege battles are fought over [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] cities. The attacker must breach the defences and either capture the [[sl:battle_victory_points]]victory point[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_leadership]]rout[[/sl]] the defending [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] to gain control of the city.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Siege battles are fought over [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] cities. localised_text.last_approved_text: Siege weapons are large, constructed weapons of war that are used to attack the [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] during [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battles[[/sl]]. Rams are used to breach the city gates, and siege towers are used to get troops on top of the city walls.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Some [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] can skirmish, whereby they automatically retreat when the enemy get too close. localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] may cast powerful spells to turn the tide of battle. Available spells are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when a Wizard unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Terrain features on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] can play a decisive role in any battle. Hills, mountains, forests and rivers can be used to [[sl:battle_visibility]]conceal troops[[/sl]] or funnel an enemy’s advance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in battle, who leads and encourages the troops with many unique [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Most [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] have abilities that modify the unit’s behaviour or improve it's capabilities for a short time. These can be activated or deactivated as the situation demands.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] may choose to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]confederate into one faction if conditions between them are right. localised_text.last_approved_text: Corruption is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] influence in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], and is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. Excessive corruption in a province can lead to [[sl:campaign_public_order]]unrest[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]], and eventually an uprising if left unchecked.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Millennia have passed since the Dark Elves, or Druchii in the Elven tongue, violently split from the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]]. Banished from Ulthuan, the spiteful and wicked Dark Elves plot the demise of their former brethren from Naggaroth, their home continent. They have been ruled throughout their long history by Malekith, the Witch King.

They have been ruled throughout their long history by Malekith, the Witch King.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] factions awaken units they wish to field in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and do not need to pay [[img:icon_money]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] for their [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] or upkeep. The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] of each type that may be fielded is determined by constructed military [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex siphons the greater part of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] from the world, and is thus all that holds back an unstoppable tide of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] from the realms beyond. In the Eye of the Vortex campaign, the vortex is unstable, and several [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] of the world work to influence it to their own ends.

localised_text.last_approved_text: No sooner has Malekith issued his commandment to Felicion than word reaches him that Naggarond is under attack. A treacherous band of Skaven and their Marauder allies have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to strike at the Dark Elf heartland.\nCursing the perfidious ratmen, Malekith gathers his retinue and hurries back to the shore to mete out their punishment in person.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: No sooner has Malekith issued his commandment to Felicion than word reaches him that Naggarond is under attack. A treacherous band of Skaven and their Marauder allies have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to strike at the Dark Elf heartland.\nCursing the perfidious ratmen, Malekith gathers his retinue and hurries back to the shore to mete out their punishment in person.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lord Mazdamundi is now fully roused and ready to enact his interpretation of the Great Plan. The spawnings are gathering at City of the Sun, for he senses a disturbance in the Geomantic Web surrounding Hexoatl, his capital. Communing telepathically with his fellow Slann, Mazdamundi learns of the invasion of his jungles by an army of tribal warmbloods.\nThe warmbloods in question are worshippers of the Ancient Enemy from the colony of Skeggi, notorious savages that dwell on the shores of the Lustria. Incited by the appearance of the comet, the Norse have launched an invasion of the Lustrian interior.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Lord Mazdamundi is now fully roused and ready to enact his interpretation of the Great Plan. The spawnings are gathering at City of the Sun, for he senses a disturbance in the Geomantic Web surrounding Hexoatl, his capital. Communing telepathically with his fellow Slann, Mazdamundi learns of the invasion of his jungles by an army of tribal warmbloods.\nThe warmbloods in question are worshippers of the Ancient Enemy from the colony of Skeggi, notorious savages that dwell on the shores of the Lustria. Incited by the appearance of the comet, the Norse have launched an invasion of the Lustrian interior.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Queek Headtaker, the scion of Clan Mors, emerges from under the City of Pillars. Dispatched by Grey Seer Vulscreek at the behest of the Council of Thirteen, Warlord Queek and his forces are sent to a nest-lair under the ruined city of Yuatek, deep in the Southlands.\n\nQueek's task is to garner as much precious Warpstone as possible and repel a nascent invasion of hated Elf-things. The High Elf incursion is surely linked with the comet's appearance. In any case, Queek is thirsty for blood, and Elven blood flows the richest of all!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Queek Headtaker, the scion of Clan Mors, emerges from under the City of Pillars. Dispatched by Grey Seer Vulscreek at the behest of the Council of Thirteen, Warlord Queek and his forces are sent to a nest-lair under the ruined city of Yuatek, deep in the Southlands.\n\nQueek's task is to garner as much precious Warpstone as possible and repel a nascent invasion of hated Elf-things. The High Elf incursion is surely linked with the comet's appearance. In any case, Queek is thirsty for blood, and Elven blood flows the richest of all!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Ever-watchful for a chance to strike at their mortal enemies, the hateful Dark Elves have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to launch an invasion of Ulthuan, the divine home of the High Elves. Lothern, the High Elf capital city and seat of the Phoenix King, is gravely threatened.\nCursing his brother's absence, and with the few forces at his disposal, Tyrion marches south to lead the counterattack.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Ever-watchful for a chance to strike at their mortal enemies, the hateful Dark Elves have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to launch an invasion of Ulthuan, the divine home of the High Elves. Lothern, the High Elf capital city and seat of the Phoenix King, is gravely threatened.\nCursing his brother's absence, and with the few forces at his disposal, Tyrion marches south to lead the counterattack.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The more armies you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ - your officials having little idea where they may have gone...

localised_text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren gives its energy to the Asrai as they grow. The stronger they become, the more power they draw from the forests. For every army you field, the more expensive it becomes to maintain them; drawing strength from Athel Loren comes with a price.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Athel Loren gives its energy to the Asrai as they grow. The stronger they become, the more power they draw from the forests. For every army you field, the more expensive it becomes to maintain them; drawing strength from Athel Loren comes with a price.

localised_text.last_approved_text: As your realm grows, you will require the aid of other Lords whose loyalty may be tied more strongly to their Clans, or who may have ancient debts of blood and gold to pay. In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: As your realm grows, you will require the aid of other Lords whose loyalty may be tied more strongly to their Clans, or who may have ancient debts of blood and gold to pay. In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Dark Magic is unique - the greater its concentration, the more Dark Magic will be drawn to it. If the Winds of Dhar are shared between powerful Vampires and Necromancers, however, Dark Magic becomes more difficult to accumulate - their Undead legions requiring more energy to remain bound.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Victory! In a world of Chaos, a time of heroes, an age of war, you have overcome every challenge laid before you, faced down every foe bent upon your destruction. This strange and dangerous realm, riven with battle, bloodshed and slaughter, twisted beyond sanity by the warping power of Chaos, has seen the foundering of many a mighty empire, yet yours remains triumphant and unconquered, victorious in defiance of all.\n\n

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Victory! In a world of Chaos, a time of heroes, an age of war, you have overcome every challenge laid before you, faced down every foe bent upon your destruction. This strange and dangerous realm, riven with battle, bloodshed and slaughter, twisted beyond sanity by the warping power of Chaos, has seen the foundering of many a mighty empire, yet yours remains triumphant and unconquered, victorious in defiance of all.\n\n

localised_text.last_approved_text: In cities under your control across the world, citizens throng the streets to greet the dawning of a new age. Burghers, merchants, veterans, masters and apprentices, all raise their voices as one in a joyful shout of acclamation "For the Emperor! For Sigmar! For the Heldenhammer!"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: In cities under your control across the world, citizens throng the streets to greet the dawning of a new age. Burghers, merchants, veterans, masters and apprentices, all raise their voices as one in a joyful shout of acclamation "For the Emperor! For Sigmar! For the Heldenhammer!"

localised_text.last_approved_text: Ptra is pleased, for the desert gods have returned and are a force in the world once again. Nehekhara is resurgent – the greatest of all civilisations returns to prominence and domination. The mightiest kings and queens sit upon thrones of bone and look down upon the living with jealous contempt. Now, the Realm of Souls splits asunder and the Day of Awakening is at hand!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Ptra is pleased, for the desert gods have returned and are a force in the world once again. Nehekhara is resurgent – the greatest of all civilisations returns to prominence and domination. The mightiest kings and queens sit upon thrones of bone and look down upon the living with jealous contempt. Now, the Realm of Souls splits asunder and the Day of Awakening is at hand!

localised_text.last_approved_text: For thousands of years, the Dark Elves have plundered the riches of the world, using the blood and treasure of distant lands to fuel their war against the High Elves and others. Millions groan under the yoke of their slavery, or choke out their last on the altars of the Bloody-handed God. Under your dominion, the empire of malice reigns supreme!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: For thousands of years, the Dark Elves have plundered the riches of the world, using the blood and treasure of distant lands to fuel their war against the High Elves and others. Millions groan under the yoke of their slavery, or choke out their last on the altars of the Bloody-handed God. Under your dominion, the empire of malice reigns supreme!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The High Elves have stood guard over this world for millennia, defending it from the worshippers of unholy gods and the unthinking meddling of lesser races. Now, under your stewardship, the Glittering Hosts have beaten these foes into retreat or oblivion. An age of peace dawns, founded on the glory of the Elves!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The High Elves have stood guard over this world for millennia, defending it from the worshippers of unholy gods and the unthinking meddling of lesser races. Now, under your stewardship, the Glittering Hosts have beaten these foes into retreat or oblivion. An age of peace dawns, founded on the glory of the Elves!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Long before the rise of the younger races, the Lizardmen ruled supreme. After countless disasters and aeons of decline you have led them to the brink of success, finally enacting the unfinished plans of their long-lost cosmic masters!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Long before the rise of the younger races, the Lizardmen ruled supreme. After countless disasters and aeons of decline you have led them to the brink of success, finally enacting the unfinished plans of their long-lost cosmic masters!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The warped history of the corrupted Skaven race lists their many attempts to overthrow and enslave the other civilisations under the iron claw of Skaven rule. Now, under your control, the verminous hordes seethe openly across the face of the world, chittering their triumph in praise of the Great Horned Rat!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The warped history of the corrupted Skaven race lists their many attempts to overthrow and enslave the other civilisations under the iron claw of Skaven rule. Now, under your control, the verminous hordes seethe openly across the face of the world, chittering their triumph in praise of the Great Horned Rat!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yet what is talk of empires to the destroyer of all civilisations? Let the shattered cities smoulder to ash, let briar and thorn reclaim their tumbled stones and bleached bones. Your warherds roam lands returned to their primal roots, braying a triumphant challenge to storm-wracked skies!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yet what is talk of empires to the destroyer of all civilisations? Let the shattered cities smoulder to ash, let briar and thorn reclaim their tumbled stones and bleached bones. Your warherds roam lands returned to their primal roots, braying a triumphant challenge to storm-wracked skies!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yet your empire is not built from stones piled one upon another, on trade rooted in the sack of the land. Rather, it is the oldest empire of all; that of root and branch, leaf and bough. Its mighty hosts stretch unbroken from shore to shore once more, their deep roots anchoring the land, their song of triumph the whisper of leaves stirring in the breeze.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yet your empire is not built from stones piled one upon another, on trade rooted in the sack of the land. Rather, it is the oldest empire of all; that of root and branch, leaf and bough. Its mighty hosts stretch unbroken from shore to shore once more, their deep roots anchoring the land, their song of triumph the whisper of leaves stirring in the breeze.

localised_text.last_approved_text: That which is sacrosanct has been preserved. That which is sublime has been protected. That which threatened has been destroyed. Your name and deeds of heroism will be remembered always. For Bretonnia, and for the Lady!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: That which is sacrosanct has been preserved. That which is sublime has been protected. That which threatened has been destroyed. Your name and deeds of heroism will be remembered always. For Bretonnia, and for the Lady!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Yet your empire is not one of petty territory, rather it is an empire of blood and Chaos, where mighty Champions rise and fall, striving ceaselessly against each other for the favour of the Dark Gods. And at their pinnacle you stand, mighty and unvanquished, Lord of All, and most favoured by the Gods of Chaos!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Yet your empire is not one of petty territory, rather it is an empire of blood and Chaos, where mighty Champions rise and fall, striving ceaselessly against each other for the favour of the Dark Gods. And at their pinnacle you stand, mighty and unvanquished, Lord of All, and most favoured by the Gods of Chaos!

localised_text.last_approved_text: In Karaks reclaimed according to the oaths laid down in the Great Book of Grudges, and in countless other mining colonies, trading posts, villages and great cities across the world, your people throng the halls in celebration, and many a horn of ale is raised on high to join the drinking songs and the fierce voices crying "Vengeance is ours!"

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: In Karaks reclaimed according to the oaths laid down in the Great Book of Grudges, and in countless other mining colonies, trading posts, villages and great cities across the world, your people throng the halls in celebration, and many a horn of ale is raised on high to join the drinking songs and the fierce voices crying "Vengeance is ours!"

localised_text.last_approved_text: Whilst other races have shown nothing but weakness, wasting their time on nonsense such as honour and duty, the Greenskins have followed their nature, given to them by Gork (and Mork), striving against each other until none but the mightiest remain to engulf the world in an endless Waaagh!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Whilst other races have shown nothing but weakness, wasting their time on nonsense such as honour and duty, the Greenskins have followed their nature, given to them by Gork (and Mork), striving against each other until none but the mightiest remain to engulf the world in an endless Waaagh!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Under your command, legions of the living have been relieved of the burden of life's struggle, and raised again into your eternal service. Those still permitted to cling to the misery of life are now as cattle, prey to the depraved hunger of your numberless dark servants, whose triumphant shrieks pierce the eternal night!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Under your command, legions of the living have been relieved of the burden of life's struggle, and raised again into your eternal service. Those still permitted to cling to the misery of life are now as cattle, prey to the depraved hunger of your numberless dark servants, whose triumphant shrieks pierce the eternal night!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Their feeble Phoenix King will once again own the Vortex, and their kingdoms shall be shielded by that traitor, Caledor Dragontamer! If you are to bring about the absolute destruction of the Asur and their homeland, then the invasion of the Isle of the Dead must begin! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Their feeble Phoenix King will once again own the Vortex, and their kingdoms shall be shielded by that traitor, Caledor Dragontamer! If you are to bring about the absolute destruction of the Asur and their homeland, then the invasion of the Isle of the Dead must begin! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. Their cold-blooded armies arrive on the Isle of the Dead to claim the Great Vortex - the prize that is rightfully yours. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. Their cold-blooded armies arrive on the Isle of the Dead to claim the Great Vortex - the prize that is rightfully yours. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The vermin think to rob us of our vengeance and to claim the Vortex before you. They must be purged from hated Ulthuan. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The vermin think to rob us of our vengeance and to claim the Vortex before you. They must be purged from hated Ulthuan. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The goblet brims with the lifeforce of victims claimed by your sorcerous vassal and her assassin. Now is the time to move on hated Ulthuan and claim the power of the Vortex! The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you! Yet the vermin have been enacting their own devious, world-shattering plot. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Vortex is your tool for ultimate vengeance; the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

Yet the vermin have been enacting their own devious, world-shattering plot. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Vortex is your tool for ultimate vengeance; the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The greatest of all fears has come true, the Druchii have enacted their final ritual. The legions of the Witch King defile Ulthuan’s heart. Malekith intends to step into the Vortex and claim its power, which will surely mean the end of the Asur! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The greatest of all fears has come true, the Druchii have enacted their final ritual. The legions of the Witch King defile Ulthuan’s heart. Malekith intends to step into the Vortex and claim its power, which will surely mean the end of the Asur! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The cohorts of Lord Mazdamundi have invaded Ulthuan – they wish to control the Vortex, a creation of the Asur! Their goals are not the same as ours; the ancient Mage-Priest could easily decide to sink Ulthuan beneath the sea in order to permanently safeguard the Vortex. It has to be returned into the care of the High Elves. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The cohorts of Lord Mazdamundi have invaded Ulthuan – they wish to control the Vortex, a creation of the Asur! Their goals are not the same as ours; the ancient Mage-Priest could easily decide to sink Ulthuan beneath the sea in order to permanently safeguard the Vortex. It has to be returned into the care of the High Elves. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. That they befoul the heart of Ulthuan is crime enough, but should the vermin take control of the Vortex, it will surely mean doom for the world. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. That they befoul the heart of Ulthuan is crime enough, but should the vermin take control of the Vortex, it will surely mean doom for the world. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: At the very heart of Ulthuan, upon the Isle of the Dead, the greatest of all battles must be fought. Enemies from many realms gather, ready for war. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Star Crown is now re-forged and so the Vortex can be saved, but first the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: At the very heart of Ulthuan, upon the Isle of the Dead, the greatest of all battles must be fought. Enemies from many realms gather, ready for war. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Star Crown is now re-forged and so the Vortex can be saved, but first the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. These lost servants have long since forgotten their original purpose and consort with Daemon-spawn. Their first generation marches on the Vortex, and will consume its power. This has been foreseen in the lost plaques of Tlanxla and it cannot be allowed. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. These lost servants have long since forgotten their original purpose and consort with Daemon-spawn. Their first generation marches on the Vortex, and will consume its power. This has been foreseen in the lost plaques of Tlanxla and it cannot be allowed. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. They have proven inadequate caretakers of the Great Vortex. It is time to merge the Great Warding and the Vortex once and for all, safeguarding the world for eternity. The Elf-spawn are too young, proud and self-assured to allow this. They shall be chastised for their own good and that of all creation. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. They have proven inadequate caretakers of the Great Vortex. It is time to merge the Great Warding and the Vortex once and for all, safeguarding the world for eternity. The Elf-spawn are too young, proud and self-assured to allow this. They shall be chastised for their own good and that of all creation. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The Rat-spawn are abominations that should never have existed in the first place – that they now come in reach of the Great Vortex is the greatest of all crimes against the Old Ones. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The Rat-spawn are abominations that should never have existed in the first place – that they now come in reach of the Great Vortex is the greatest of all crimes against the Old Ones. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Great Warding is bolstered and the Geomantic energies flow once more. Our many enemies sense their plans are in jeopardy and gather to stop you, but your attention must turn to the Rat-spawn that defile the Isle of the Dead at the centre of Ulthuan. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Rat-spawn must be purged and the Vortex restored. This is the will of the Old Ones - prepare for the ultimate battle!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Great Warding is bolstered and the Geomantic energies flow once more. Our many enemies sense their plans are in jeopardy and gather to stop you, but your attention must turn to the Rat-spawn that defile the Isle of the Dead at the centre of Ulthuan. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Rat-spawn must be purged and the Vortex restored. This is the will of the Old Ones - prepare for the ultimate battle!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. Victory is in their grasp, and failure is in yours! If the Witch King-thing takes the Vortex, the Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the nasty Elves before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. Victory is in their grasp, and failure is in yours! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Soon they will reclaim the Vortex. Failure of the great scheme is imminent. The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Elf-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Soon they will reclaim the Vortex. Failure of the great scheme is imminent. The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Elf-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The nasty Toad-thing has transported his cohorts onto the dead isle - the Vortex is all but theirs. Failure of the great scheme is imminent! The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Reptile-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizard-things from claiming victory!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The nasty Toad-thing has transported his cohorts onto the dead isle - the Vortex is all but theirs. Failure of the great scheme is imminent! The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Reptile-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizard-things from claiming victory!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Machine of Doom and Curses is ready! The Grey Seer Clan and their masters on the Council of Thirteen tried to betray you… but now, thanks to the scribe’s wrath, it is the Grey Seer’s blood imprinted on the unholy bell’s Warpstone clapper! And so the Grey Seer Clan shall be sacrificed - consumed by the Horned Rat on His arrival. Upon the Isle of the Dead, in the heart of hated Ulthuan, the machine begins its work - turning the Vortex into a portal from which your god shall emerge. The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you. Above all, the Grey Seers send their minions - desperate to halt the Great Ascendancy. The unholy bell must toll thirteen times - prepare for the ultimate battle!

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Machine of Doom and Curses is ready! And so the Grey Seer Clan shall be sacrificed - consumed by the Horned Rat on His arrival. Upon the Isle of the Dead, in the heart of hated Ulthuan, the machine begins its work - turning the Vortex into a portal from which your god shall emerge. The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you. Above all, the Grey Seers send their minions - desperate to halt the Great Ascendancy. The unholy bell must toll thirteen times - prepare for the ultimate battle!
